maml:description.maml:para: Adds a role assignment to a principal.
The Add-SPRoleAssignment cmdlet adds a permission to a principal (User or Group).

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the user ID or group ID.
Indicates the role definition ID.
Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the list item ID.
Indicates the user ID or group ID.
Indicates the role definition ID.
Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the list item ID.
Indicates the user ID or group ID.
Indicates the role definition ID.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds site read permission to the principal.
Adds list contribute permission to the principal.
Adds list full control permission to the principal.

maml:description.maml:para: Connects to SharePoint Online.
The Connect-SPOnline cmdlet creates new connection to SharePoint Online.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the authorization endpoint URL. This parameter is provided for some environment. (Germany, China, and US Government)
Indicates the credential (user name and password).
Indicates the site URL.
Indicates the authorization endpoint URL. This parameter is provided for some environment. (Germany, China, and US Government)
Indicates the site URL.
If speficied, retrieves the admin consent URL.
Indicates the authorization endpoint URL. This parameter is provided for some environment. (Germany, China, and US Government)
Indicates the credential (user name and password).
Indicates the site URL.
If speficied, retrieves the admin consent URL.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to SharePoint Online with device code.
Connects to SharePoint Online with user name and password.
Retrieves the admin consent URL.

maml:description.maml:para: Connects to SharePoint Server.
The Connect-SPServer cmdlet creates new connection to SharePoint Server. (On-premiss)

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the credential (user name and password).
Indicates the site URL.
Indicates the credential (user name and password).
Indicates the site URL.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to SharePoint Server with user name and password.

maml:description.maml:para: Lists content types.
The Find-SPContentType cmdlet retrieves all content types.

Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a sub site.
The Get-SPWeb cmdlet retrieves the sub site which matches the parameter.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the web ID or URL.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the web ID or URL.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the web by ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new content type.
The New-SPWeb cmdlet adds a new content type to a site or list.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the URL of a custom display form.
Indicates the URL of a custom edit form.
Indicates the group.
Indicates the value whether to hide from user.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the JSLink URL.
Indicates the URL of a custom display form for mobile.
Indicates the URL of a custom edit form for mobile.
Indicates the URL of a custom new form for mobile.
Indicates the name.
Indicates the URL of a custom new form.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the URL of a custom display form.
Indicates the URL of a custom edit form.
Indicates the group.
Indicates the value whether to hide from user.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the JSLink URL.
Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the URL of a custom display form for mobile.
Indicates the URL of a custom edit form for mobile.
Indicates the URL of a custom new form for mobile.
Indicates the name.
Indicates the URL of a custom new form.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new content type to a site.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SPContentType -List 'Shared Documents' -Name 'My Content Type'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new content type to a list.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new role definition.
The New-SPRoleDefinition cmdlet adds a new role definition to a site.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the role definition base permissions.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the name.
Indicates the role definition base permissions.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new role definition to a site.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new sub site.
The New-SPWeb cmdlet adds a new site to the its parent site.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the description.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the LCID.
Indicates the display name.
Indicates the internal name.
If specified, the site will inherit permissions from its parent site.
Indicates the template ID.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the LCID.
Indicates the display name.
Indicates the internal name.
If specified, the site will inherit permissions from its parent site.
Indicates the template ID.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SPWeb -Url 'Portal' -Title 'Company Portal' -Description 'This is a company portal site.' -WebTemplate 'STS#0'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new site to the its parent site.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a content type.
The Remove-SPContentType cmdlet removes a content type from a site or list.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the content type ID.
Indicates the content type ID.
Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the content type ID.
Indicates the list ID or title.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the site content type.
Removes the list content type.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a role assignment from a principal.
The Remove-SPRoleAssignment cmdlet removes a permission from a principal (User or Group).

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the user ID or group ID.
Indicates the role definition ID.
Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the list item ID.
Indicates the user ID or group ID.
Indicates the role definition ID.
Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the list item ID.
Indicates the user ID or group ID.
Indicates the role definition ID.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes site read permission from the principal.
Removes list contribute permission from the principal.
Removes list full control permission from the principal.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a role definition.
The Remove-SPRoleDefinition cmdlet removes a role definition from a site.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the role definition ID, name or type.
Indicates the role definition ID, name or type.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the role definition from the site.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the site.
The Remove-SPWeb cmdlet removes the current site from its parent site.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the current site from its parent site.

maml:description.maml:para: Select a site.
The Select-SPWeb cmdlet set the site which matches the parameter to current.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the web ID or URL.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
If specified, returns the selected object.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
If specified, returns the selected object.
Indicates the web ID or URL.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Changes the current web by ID.
Changes the current web by URL.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a content type.
The Update-SPContentType cmdlet updates the content type property.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the content type ID.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the value whether to hide from user.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the JSLink URL.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Indicates the content type ID.
Indicates the list ID or title.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the value whether to hide from user.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the JSLink URL.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Indicates the content type ID.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the value whether to hide from user.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the JSLink URL.
Indicates the list ID or title.
If specified, returns the updated object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates display name of the site content type.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Update-SPContentType -List 'Shared Documents' -ContentType '0x0100DFF682E1FF5A8A4EA7A6370B7D0A8104' -Description 'My Content Type'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates display name of the list content type.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a role definition.
The Update-SPRoleDefinition cmdlet updates the role definition property.

Indicates the role definition base permissions.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the name.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Indicates the role definition base permissions.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the name.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Indicates the ID, name or type.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates base permissions of a role definition.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a site.
The Update-SPWeb cmdlet updates the current site property.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates the alternate style sheet URL.
Indicates the custom master page URL.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the value whether to use Minimal Download Strategy.
Indicates the value whether to use a footer.
Indicates the value whether to hide the site logo to user.
Indicates the value whether to hide the site title to user.
Indicates the property name collection to include in the result object.
Indicates the master page URL.
Indicates the value whether to forbid to crawl the site.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Indicates the value whether to use the quick launch.
Indicates the value whether to allow to save the site as a template.
Indicates the server relative URL.
Indicates the site logo URL.
Indicates the title.
Indicates the value whether to use the tree view.
Indicates the UI version.
Indicates the value whether the settings UI for visual upgrade.
Indicates the welcome page URL.

Indicates the value whether to use a footer.

Indicates the value whether to forbid to crawl the site.

Indicates the site logo URL.
